timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Ah, good to know! I'll get of this, then.
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: I would rather call this Component1
timeline.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText:
This is an identifier that you would tend to use in a sample, and model the properties and commands accordingly. So, in this case, it made sense to call this Thermostat1, since it signifies that the component getting modelled is a Thermostat, and the index is 1.
If I call this Component1, then my property update handlers, command handlers etc will lose context as to what interface Component1 actually implements.
Does that make sense?
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: call it Property to update? or add a comment?
timeline.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: This value can ideally be used anywhere, property update/ telemetry/ command response etc. I don't see the value in tying it to the usage here.
replies.author: abhipsaMisra
